definition: lit. to open a water source and reduce outflow (idiom); to increase income and save on spending/to broaden the sources of income and economize on expenditure

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
root/source/origin
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: After the holidays, many are ready to take control of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 在节后，他们很多人才在生活中开始开源节流。

sentences.english: Therefore, broadening sources of income and reducing expenditure is the key.
sentences.chinese: 如何“开源节流”成为应对危机的关键。

sentences.english: He created the modern American civil service and throttled patronage politics.
sentences.chinese: 他开创了美国现代公民服务型政府和开源节流式政治。

definition: to control flow/to choke/weir valve/a throttle/a choke
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
meticulous planning and careful accounting (idiom)
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to deposit money/to save money
lit. eating away next year's food in advance/fig. to dip into the next month's check/live now, pay later
extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
surplus/profit
lit. just sitting and eating, one can deplete even a mountain of wealth (idiom)/fig. to spend one's money without generating any income
to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
cash flow/financial balance/income and expenditure
to spend/to pay out/expense
to pay (expenses)/expenses/(old) to dismiss (an employee)
to keep accounts/bookkeeping/to charge to an account
to practice strict economy (idiom)
